titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Music Calendar Collection, 1968-2007
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Rebecca Belford.

publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in EAD by Rebecca Belford, April 2007.

did.head: Collection Overview

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.langmaterial: Collection material in English, German, French, and Italian

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: A collection of calendars with music-themed artwork and text, mostly published in the United States and Germany.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Music Calendar Collection, 1968-2007, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Music calendars acquired intermittently by the Music Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Most of the calendars in the collection feature reproductions of art and photographs that depict musical scenes, composers, performers, or instruments. Among the more well-represented topics in the collection are musical instruments, opera, jazz, and music manuscripts. Many calendars also include historical or biographical information, significant dates in musical history, and biographical or historical information about the creators of the artwork. In addition to reproductions of photographs and paintings, media represented include musical instruments, realia, sheet-music and album covers, and illuminated manuscripts and miniatures.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Music Library staff created this collection by a variety of means: solicitation, collation of calendars received with existng serial subscriptions, and donation of calendars from personal sources.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is one series, arranged by size, then grouped by publisher and arranged chronologically.
